sen.j: 江村 専斎（えむら せんさい、永禄8年（1565年） - 寛文4年9月26日 (旧暦)（1664年11月13日））は、安土桃山時代・江戸時代の儒医。
sen.e: Sensai EMURA (1565 - November 13, 1664) was a Confucian doctor in the Azuchi-Momoyama and Edo periods.

sen.j: 秦宗巴に従って医を学び、濂洛の学を修め、儒医をもって肥後国熊本藩主の加藤清正に仕えた。
sen.e: Sensai studied medicine under Souha HATA, and studied a school of Confucianism called Renraku; then, he served Kiyomasa KATO, the lord of Kumamoto domain in Higo Province as a Confucian Physician.

sen.j: 加藤の死後は京都に帰り、寛永年間に美作国津山藩主の森忠政に招かれ、賓師の礼をもって遇された。
sen.e: After the death of Kiyomasa KATO, Sensai returned to Kyoto; later, during the Kanei era, he was invited by Tadamasa MORI, the lord of Tsuyama domain in Mimasaka Province and treated as a teacher of the lord with respect.

sen.j: 後水尾天皇に養生法を尋ねられて「養生の秘訣は別儀なし、飲食些く思慮も些し、ただ些の一字を体得するにあり」と答えた。
sen.e: In response to a request for his regimen by Emperor Gomizunoo, Sensai answered 'I do not have any special regimen; I drink moderate, eat moderate, and worry moderate. I just have mastered doing moderate everything.'
